This year, House Democrats have fought tirelessly #ForThePeople, passing hundreds of bills that raise the minimum wage, secure protections for the LGBTQ+ community, and so much more. 

Our fight continues in 2020. #HappyNewYear! pic.twitter.com/kno6rsitB8

Climate change is an environmental issue, and it’s also a justice issue. Underserved communities & communities of color – here in the U.S. and around the world – suffer disproportionately, like we’re already seeing with the unfolding water crisis. https://www.huffpost.com/entry/water-crisis-worsening-inequality_n_5df1515ee4b0b75fb5370796 …

Sad to hear this news about the passing of civil rights leader, advocate, and former St. Paul City Councilor Bill Wilson today. Bill was a champion for our community -- as well as my neighbor & friend. Sending my condolences to his loved ones today. https://www.twincities.com/2019/12/29/st-paul-civil-rights-leader-and-educator-bill-wilson-dies-at-79/ …

Despite Pres. Trump’s extreme climate denial & withdrawal from the #ParisAgreement, progress is still being made to reduce emissions & combat climate change. Minnesota is still in. #WeAreStillIn. https://www.mprnews.org/episode/2019/12/19/minnesota-among-25-states-on-track-to-meet-paris-climate-goals …

It’s official – according to @EENewsUpdates, I’ve made the nice list this year! Or rather, I made the “E&E News Appropriations Winners” list. I'm proud of this bill and the meaningful investments it makes in protecting our environment & public health.
 https://www.eenews.net/stories/1061857847 … pic.twitter.com/vDRqYZtXpp

All of this progress – including 275 bills with bipartisan support – sit gathering dust outside @SenateMajLdr’s office. 

May 2020 be the year Mr. McConnell decides to do his job & bring up these bills for a vote. pic.twitter.com/s8iWn9dVBO

House Democrats are also committed to making sure the economy works for everyone – not just those at the top. We passed legislation to raise the minimum wage & ensure equal pay for equal work, and ensure retirement security for seniors through the #ButchLewisAct.

The House passed #HR3, which expands the services Medicare covers & addresses the skyrocketing cost of prescriptions – like insulin, which has seen a 197% cost increase. We're working to #LowerDrugCosts & reduce out-of-pocket medical expenses #ForThePeople.

The House also approved additional legislation to safeguard our elections, the #SHIELDAct & SAFEAct. We also passed #HR4 to expand protections for voters under the #VotingRightsAct, after a Supreme Court decision removed many of these protections in 2013.
In the face of a culture of corruption embraced by Pres. Trump & the GOP, the House passed #HR1—the #ForThePeople Act—to restore and strengthen our democracy & elections.

The crisis of climate change has been top of mind. We passed #HR9, which would prevent Mr. Trump from pulling the U.S. out of the Paris Climate Agreement. I joined @SpeakerPelosi at #COP25 to send a message to the rest of the world: #WeAreStillIn.  https://bit.ly/2Mba6gv

The House also passed #HR8 to help address gun violence from another angle – strengthening background checks for gun purchases to keep guns out of the hands of those who shouldn’t have them. We’re committed to keep fighting to end this epidemic.

As a member of @AppropsDems, I’m proud that for the first time in decades, funding has been appropriated for gun violence research – treating it as the public health crisis it is. We took action because thoughts & prayers simply aren’t enough. pic.twitter.com/iBnNy8N4eZ
.@HouseDemocrats fought hard to ensure all 12 appropriations bills make investments that reflect our Democratic priorities: to #ProtectOurCare, #ActOnClimate, #EndGunViolence, and more.

Our oversight actions led to the @USGAO finding that the Trump admin broke the law by using national park entrance fees to keep parks open during the #TrumpShutdown. Congress holds the power of the purse—period. We’ll keep holding this admin accountable.
$36 billion in federal funding will be signed into law to protect clean air & water, fund Indian health care & education programs, fight climate change, protect our public lands, and more.

As Chair of the Interior-Environment Appropriations Subcommittee, I took the lead in making smart, focused investments in the agencies & programs that protect our public health & the environment. pic.twitter.com/wAkGAu21ve
Congress has officially taken its last votes of the year (and of the decade!), so I want to share some highlights from the past year since Democrats took control of the House of Representatives:

Thank you, @RepDeanPhillips! Your support is critical to protecting #BWCA for future generations. Proud to stand together in this fight. https://twitter.com/RepDeanPhillips/status/1208063469930635264 …

The revised #USMCA creates stronger protections for the environment and workers, and improved monitoring and enforcement mechanisms – making it the new standard for U.S. trade agreements and a win for the economy & American workers.

Despite the GOP view that this conduct is acceptable, I view it as an intolerable offense & a high crime. Pres. Trump also obstructed Congress from exercising oversight powers given to the House by the Constitution. The future of our democracy calls on us to act. #DefendDemocracy

Withholding vital military aid to Ukraine while attempting to coerce a foreign power to undermine our 2020 election is an egregious abuse of power & an impeachable offense. Pres. Trump acted not to protect our national security, but to benefit his 2020 re-election campaign. https://twitter.com/HouseDemocrats/status/1207413172287594496 …
Only 5 days left in Minnesota’s open enrollment period! Don’t miss out on your chance to sign up for health care coverage in 2020. #GetCovered at  http://mnsure.org  today. pic.twitter.com/auCixp1Lju

Days after White House budget negotiators fought to conceal government information about the impact of sulfide-ore mining on #BWCA, Twin Metals has released its mine plan. Pres. Trump & the GOP are determined to pollute MN waters to extract profits. https://bit.ly/38Of6kZ
Thank you to my colleague & human rights champion @RepMaxineWaters for signing on as a co-sponsor of #HR2407! Military detention is #NoWayToTreatAChild. pic.twitter.com/T3YjgqOOP5

The House also approved #HR1158, which makes important investments to protect our national security and those who defend it – including a $172 million investment to address PFAS (“forever chemicals”) & keep our military families safe. My full statement: https://bit.ly/36EEUxQ

As Chair of the Interior-Environment @AppropsDems Subcommittee, I’m proud of the final bill the House approved today – the result of months of work to invest in the health & safety of our communities & our environment. #ForThePeople #HR1865 
My statement:  https://bit.ly/2S1HU3j  pic.twitter.com/6aNuLLghuV

75 years after the Battle of the Bulge, we remember the sacrifice of the Belgian, Allied, and American armed forces who gave their lives in service to the values of democracy & freedom. We are forever grateful.

Doug Woog was not just a champion Gopher, but a beloved leader, visionary and friend to many. Sending my deepest condolences to his loved ones. http://strib.mn/2RSSmdx

The @FCC has approved an easy-to-remember 3-digit hotline number (similar to 911) for those in need of immediate suicide crisis care. For now, the best resource is still (800) 273-8255 – but I’m glad to see this progress. Mental health care is health care. http://cnn.it/2PjcgNb

I recently received two scam calls saying my Social Security Number had been suspended. But the Social Security Administration will *never* threaten you or tell you that your SSN has been or may be suspended. 

Hang up and report these scams at  http://oig.ssa.gov/ .

If you’re planning a visit to the nation’s capital now through Jan. 5, 2020, be sure to check it out:  https://www.usbg.gov/plan-your-holiday-visit …

Striking to see these methane leaks that are typically invisible to the human eye. Methane is an enormous driver of climate change – yet the Trump admin is moving to relax the rules for polluters, allowing more leaks & endangering our communities. https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2019/12/12/climate/texas-methane-super-emitters.html?action=click&module=Top%20Stories&pgtype=Homepage&fbclid=IwAR3EGVuaY88j46rff8BHJLbyfq1z72r0s7YR6WdJgzJ-5LHbznIQijf2SPc …

The bill expands the services Medicare covers & addresses the skyrocketing cost of prescriptions. Now it’s up to the Senate & @senatemajldr to act. #ForThePeople pic.twitter.com/j9O3DAd4pV

Minnesota farmers need a strong, reliable workforce—but many are struggling to find enough workers and risk closure. Today the House passed a bill that provides stability & fairness to farmers & farm workers, supports local economies, and keeps American-grown food on our tables.

#HR3 would expand the services that Medicare covers. In my district, that means more than 100,000 people could gain access to dental, vision, and hearing coverage. Health care is holistic, and Medicare coverage should reflect that. 
#LowerDrugCosts #ForThePeople pic.twitter.com/CSeOEafCMW

Medicare currently doesn’t cover comprehensive dental, vision, or hearing services – leaving tens of millions of seniors without any coverage. An untreated cavity, outdated glasses prescription, or undiagnosed hearing problem can have devastating effects on one's overall health.

It was a great discussion about how we can leverage these partnerships across government and academia to work on climate resilience, stop the spread of deforestation, provide faster humanitarian relief, and respond to natural disasters like wildfires & hurricanes.

I was happy to welcome @NGA_GEOINT to the Hill this morning for a briefing on their partnerships with civilian federal agencies and academia, including the University of Minnesota. pic.twitter.com/4S1oEBJHcF

Rx costs have skyrocketed in recent years. The price of insulin has increased 197% over the past decade, despite little change to the drug’s formula. This week, I’m voting for #HR3, the House's plan to reduce the cost of insulin & other prescription drugs. #LowerDrugCosts pic.twitter.com/2VQMCrFpB8

Two years ago, @POTUS & the @FCC repealed #NetNeutrality in a party line vote – but the fight for a free & open internet isn't over. The House passed the #SaveTheInternet Act nearly 250 days ago, and it's long past time for @senatemajldr to bring this bill to the Senate floor.

At #COP25 we made a statement, and now the House is taking action on the #ClimateCrisis: I just voted to support a package of #OceanClimateAction bills to protect coastal communities, decrease risks to our coastlines and the Great Lakes, and enhance coastal resilience. pic.twitter.com/AcAcdca7zc

Believe it or not, there’s no federal law banning insider trading – yet. That’s why I’ll vote yes on H.R. 2534 to establish a federal statute prohibiting insider trading, strengthen existing SEC rules, and hold bad actors accountable.
